I like the concept of the game - short matches with different players. I also like that there is an opportunity to create a variety of car models. 
However, I don't like some things. First of all, I think the prices are disproportionately high. 
I also don't like the fact that you change the parameters of weapons. I pay you real money for a specific offer, for example, if I buy a machine gun with unlimited bullets, but after a few months you make an update and the weapon already has a limited amount of bullets. It would be like if I bought a black car in the salon, but after regular maintenance you gave me a red one. 
Also, in the two years since I played this game, I have not found uranium ore in the chests once - it doesn't seem very fair.

I recommend the game, not the community.

As an idea, it's amazing. A platform to build your own vehicles to drive, to battle, to do whatever really, although who am I kidding, mostly battle. However as a game, it is a horrendous demonstration of greed. Players must devote their very lives to the game, grinding battle after battle to acquire the resources for even the simplest of parts... or you could just, empty your wallet into overpriced packs to get that part you wanted. The worst part is that it wasn't always like this... I tried the game pre-2020 and it wasn't bad, I left due to hardware difficulties on my end. I decided to try again almost a month ago... it's truly heartbreaking to see such a beautiful idea reduced to utter garbage. The storytelling in the game is obscure at best and the balancing mechanic is... well... "broken" would be an understatement. Picture rookie players sticking every piece of junk to their vehicle, thinking the extra armor will give them some hope for survival... only to be obliterated by the stripped down top tier cab with a singular outrageous weapon, only because their point scores are somehow close enough by the dev's standards despite the obvious unbalance. Needless to say, I left again, this time because I wasn't willing to accept this frankly disappointing standard...

Much regret, Requiem.

-P2W is beyond any imagination... you are literally forced to stay at tutorial kind of gameplay if you dont spend money, people who play Gaijin games for years call this pile of shit (crossout) "Warthunder cash cow"
-Match making is simply not fair, you usually get paired with people that have thousands of PW (power score) more than you-skill,gear,experience and knowledge gap is huge.

-Battle pass(es)/events etc. All of them have total crap with free version: tiny amount of resources you can get in one battle,grey/white gear (worst in the game) or some customization stuff (again, nothing cool, just casual and most common stuff) While in premium (paid) version of those events you have rewards that can make you literally one of the top players in means of PW: best possible gear in game, even at the beggining of paid battle pass, ton of resources (not like in free pass, amount literally goes up by 10x or even more) Unique customization parts with lot better bonuses, TON of premium currency and other goodies.

-Game support and safety app is (not) funny joke, I wanted to log into my old account and I was told to use code sent on my mobile app, to enter app I must input code that was sent IN THE APP, I had to wait several days for response from support, and the quality of help is terrible.

-Price of literally anything is sick, ~30 EURO for few customization stuff that barely gives any bonuses, all the packs or offers are as incredibly expensive as that... There is no regional pricing, every country has same price which is just cruel: while Switzerland can afford it easily cause their average pay is high, people from poorer countries can only dream of buying something.

-Wait time... Maybe game is dying, or maybe gaijin just sucks and cant set a proper match making, but wait time is diabolical. On steam I played for over 22 hours, and on the launcher for about 50, every single round was like miracle, average wait time is literally ~2 minutes and this is a very positive reduction result, sometimes it happened much longer, no matter the time:day,night,afternoon,midnight... it always took ages to load me into game.

-Events are constatly repeated, there is rarely a new event... they keep repeating same old boring stuff from ages ago, I wouldnt be suprised if the rewards were the same but Im not sure of it...

-Game is extremely grindy, regular parts cost 650 scrap, and you get about 30 scrap per round if you do average score, and thats just first tier of item, there are rare,epic,legendary,relic items and they require a lot more and use previous items: so if you want epic tier weapons for example, it requires 2 rare weapons from its tech branch, and those 2 rare weapons require 2 common weapons from its branch (EACH!)... so to get just one epic part which is not super op you need tens of hours of grind if you play without spending cash.

-Many parts can be gained only by buying it, you need "recipe" to craft legendary/relic items, and those can be only obtained from premium battle pass, some relic tier weapons dont even have recipe, they can be bought for even more cash than most of stuff in game...

-Very toxic community, no chat moderation, everyone can throw n-words or other slurs without any ban or warning. And in game like this most players spend their round on the chat blaming others for their skill issue...

-Few game modes, all of them seem very similar: horde of enemies comes from left, then right, then comes boss and thats 80% of gameplay, other 10% is PvP and next 10% are special events which are all repeated from previous years. Same maps thoughout years, only content added are packs/goodies for real cash.


[h3]Game is COMPLETLY NOT WORTH anyone's time, I have a feeling that devs try to speedrun how to kill their game and they are doing it very well.
-Worst P2W I EVER saw
-Toxic community, no moderation
-Terrible Match making and wait time
-Very boring gameplay:no new maps, no new modes, no new events
-Game support barely exist, and if by miracle you'll get answer it wont solve your issue, you will have to send e-mail once again, and then again, its pure RNG if they help, and wait time for response is several days.[/h3]

The game is a good idea, but it's the worst game in terms of player consumption.

As someone who has played the game for over 2,400 hours, I'll explain some of their methods for stealing players:

1. BP is released with illogically powerful weapons, and then, upon its expiration, they add an update that makes all its weapons weaker.

2. There are weapons in the game that cannot be crafted, but sometimes an event occurs that allows you to craft them in exchange for items that cannot be crafted. At that moment, the game offers a discount on a package that includes all the crafting resources to entice the player to purchase them.

3. The game is boring and you can't bear to play it with the same car design you have, especially since you often lose against players who use BP weapons.

4. The beautiful scene you see in the game's trailer is something that can only be accessed if you pay financially.
